metadata.name: Simplifying Simple Linear Expressions
metadata.description: Learn to combine like terms and simplify algebraic expressions.

learning_objective: Identify and combine like terms to simplify simple linear algebraic expressions
intro_context: Let's enter the world of a video game! Just like organizing your game inventory, simplifying in algebra is all about grouping similar items to make things neat and easy to understand.

mastery_progression.sample_question: In your game inventory, your items are listed as '3c' (coins) + '5w' (wood) + '2c' (coins). To organize your backpack, you must group similar items. Which two of these terms are 'like terms' that can be combined? ðŸª™
mastery_progression.mastery_criteria: Student can identify terms with the same variable (e.g., 3c and 2c).

mastery_progression.sample_question: After organizing, you go questing! You start with '4g' (gold) and find a treasure chest with '3g' more. How would you write your total amount of gold as one single, simplified term? âœ¨
mastery_progression.mastery_criteria: Student can simplify expressions like 4g + 3g to 7g.

mastery_progression.sample_question: Time for a big inventory update! You have '6p' (potions) and 9 gems. You use '2p' potions in a battle, but then find 4 more gems. Your inventory change is '6p + 9 - 2p + 4'. What's the final, simplified expression for your items? ðŸ’Ž
mastery_progression.mastery_criteria: Student can simplify expressions with variables and constants, like 6p + 9 - 2p + 4 to 4p + 13.
